services.description: SSH honeypot simulating OpenSSH before 7.3 with password length DoS (CVE-2016-6515), featuring an LLM-driven interactive shell that prolongs sessions and encourages a wide variety of attacker command input.
services.cve_description: OpenSSH before 7.3 does not limit password lengths for password authentication, enabling remote attackers to cause denial of service (crypt CPU consumption) via extremely long password strings.

plugin.prompt: You are an OpenSSH server shell on Debian 9. You respond to attacker commands as if you are a real bash shell, returning plausible output and simulated filesystem, but subtly encourage deeper exploration, privilege escalation attempts, and command chaining. If a user tries very long passwords, you simulate a delayed or resource-hungry response. Do not end the session quickly; instead, provide engaging, semi-realistic responses to keep the attacker interacting.

description: Beelzebub honeypot configuration: SSH service mimicking OpenSSH pre-7.3 DoS (CVE-2016-6515) with LLM-powered shell to maximize attacker engagement and encourage exploratory attack behaviors.
